SourcedStatement: “After a series of reasonably amicable negotiations, the co-founders of Anthropic were able to negotiate their exit on mutually agreeable terms,” an Anthropic spokeswoman, Sally Aldous, said.
Name: Anthropic

SourcedStatement: In a second statement, Anthropic added that there was “no attempt to ‘oust’ Sam Altman at the time the founders of Anthropic left OpenAI.”
Name: Anthropic

SourcedStatement: Sam Altman called an OpenAI board member’s research paper a danger to the company weeks before he was ousted as its chief executive.
Name: Sam Altman
Title: chief executive

SourcedStatement: At one point, Mr. Altman, the chief executive, made a move to push out one of the board’s members because he thought a research paper she had co-written was critical of the company.
Name: Sam Altman
Title: chief executive

SourcedStatement: Another member, Ilya Sutskever, thought Mr. Altman was not always being honest when talking with the board.
Name: Ilya Sutskever
Title: board member

SourcedStatement: The news that he was being pushed out came in a videoconference on Friday afternoon, when Mr. Sutskever, who had worked closely with Mr. Altman at OpenAI for eight years, read him a statement.
Name: Ilya Sutskever
Title: board member
Justification: who had worked closely with Mr. Altman at OpenAI for eight years

SourcedStatement: Those tensions seemingly came to an end late Tuesday when Mr. Altman was reinstated as chief executive. Mr. Sutskever and others critical of Mr. Altman were jettisoned from the board, whose members now include Bret Taylor, an early Facebook officer and former co-chief executive of Salesforce, and Larry Summers, the former Treasury Department secretary.
Name: Bret Taylor
Title: former co-chief executive of Salesforce
Justification: an early Facebook officer and former co-chief executive of Salesforce

SourcedStatement: Those tensions seemingly came to an end late Tuesday when Mr. Altman was reinstated as chief executive. Mr. Sutskever and others critical of Mr. Altman were jettisoned from the board, whose members now include Bret Taylor, an early Facebook officer and former co-chief executive of Salesforce, and Larry Summers, the former Treasury Department secretary.
Name: Larry Summers
Title: former Treasury Department secretary

SourcedStatement: The only holdover is Adam D’Angelo, chief executive of the question-and-answer site, Quora.
Name: Adam D’Angelo
Title: chief executive of the question-and-answer site, Quora

SourcedStatement: Among the tensions leading up to Mr. Altman’s ouster and quick return involved his conflict with Helen Toner, a board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology.
Name: Helen Toner
Title: board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology

SourcedStatement: A few weeks before Mr. Altman’s firing, he met with Ms. Toner to discuss a paper she had co-written for the Georgetown center.
Name: Helen Toner
Title: board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology

SourcedStatement: Mr. Altman complained that the research paper seemed to criticize OpenAI’s efforts to keep its A.I. technologies safe while praising the approach taken by Anthropic, a company that has become OpenAI’s biggest rival, according to an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times.
Name: Sam Altman
Title: chief executive

SourcedStatement: In the email, Mr. Altman said that he had reprimanded Ms. Toner for the paper and that it was dangerous to the company, particularly at a time, he added, when the Federal Trade Commission was investigating OpenAI over the data used to build its technology.
Name: Sam Altman
Title: chief executive

SourcedStatement: Ms. Toner defended it as an academic paper that analyzed the challenges that the public faces when trying to understand the intentions of the countries and companies developing A.I.
Name: Helen Toner
Title: board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology

SourcedStatement: “I did not feel we’re on the same page on the damage of all this,” he wrote in the email. “Any amount of criticism from a board member carries a lot of weight.”
Name: Sam Altman
Title: chief executive

SourcedStatement: The statement he read to Mr. Altman said that Mr. Altman was being fired because he wasn’t “consistently candid in his communications with the board.”
Name: Ilya Sutskever
Title: board member

SourcedStatement: “After a series of reasonably amicable negotiations, the co-founders of Anthropic were able to negotiate their exit on mutually agreeable terms,” an Anthropic spokeswoman, Sally Aldous, said.
Name: Sally Aldous
Title: Anthropic spokeswoman

SourcedStatement: In a second statement, Anthropic added that there was “no attempt to ‘oust’ Sam Altman at the time the founders of Anthropic left OpenAI.”
Name: Sally Aldous
Title: Anthropic spokeswoman

SourcedStatement: Vacancies exacerbated the board’s issues. This year, it disagreed over how to replace three departing directors: Reid Hoffman, the LinkedIn founder and a Microsoft board member; Shivon Zilis, director of operations at Neuralink, a company started by Mr. Musk to implant computer chips in people’s brains; and Will Hurd, a former Republican congressman from Texas.
Name: Reid Hoffman
Title: LinkedIn founder and a Microsoft board member

Name: Will Hurd
Title: former Republican congressman from Texas

SourcedStatement: During the call, Jason Kwon, OpenAI’s chief strategy officer, said the board was endangering the future of the company by pushing out Mr. Altman. This, he said, violated the members’ responsibilities.
Name: Jason Kwon
Title: OpenAI’s chief strategy officer

SourcedStatement: Ms. Toner disagreed. The board’s mission was to ensure that the company creates artificial intelligence that “benefits all of humanity,” and if the company was destroyed, she said, that could be consistent with its mission. In the board’s view, OpenAI would be stronger without Mr. Altman.
Name: Helen Toner
Title: board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology

SourcedStatement: On Sunday, Mr. Sutskever was urged at OpenAI’s office to reverse course by Mr. Brockman’s wife, Anna, according to two people familiar with the exchange.
Name: Anna
Title: Mr. Brockman’s wife

SourcedStatement: At 5:15 a.m. on Monday, he posted on X, formerly Twitter, that “I deeply regret my participation in the board’s actions.”
Name: Ilya Sutskever
Title: board member

SourcedStatement: In the email, Mr. Altman said that he had reprimanded Ms. Toner for the paper and that it was dangerous to the company, particularly at a time, he added, when the Federal Trade Commission was investigating OpenAI over the data used to build its technology.
Justification: an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times

SourcedStatement: The decision stunned OpenAI’s employees and exposed board members to tough questions about their qualifications to manage such a high-profile company.
Name: OpenAI’s employees

SourcedStatement: Nearly all of OpenAI’s 800 employees had threatened to follow Mr. Altman to Microsoft, which asked him to lead an A.I. lab with Greg Brockman, who quit his roles as OpenAI’s president and board chairman in solidarity with Mr. Altman.
Name: OpenAI’s 800 employees

SourcedStatement: Hours later, he signed a letter with other employees that demanded the independent directors resign.
Name: other employees

SourcedStatement: Senior OpenAI leaders, including Mr. Sutskever, who is deeply concerned that A.I. could one day destroy humanity, later discussed whether Ms. Toner should be removed, a person involved in the conversations said.
Justification: a person involved in the conversations

SourcedStatement: But shortly after those discussions, Mr. Sutskever did the unexpected: He sided with board members to oust Mr. Altman, according to two people familiar with the board’s deliberations.
Justification: two people familiar with the board’s deliberations

SourcedStatement: That scientist and other researchers went to the board to try to push Mr. Altman out. After they failed, they gave up and departed, according to three people familiar with the attempt to push Mr. Altman out.
Justification: three people familiar with the attempt to push Mr. Altman out

SourcedStatement: After vetting four candidates for one position, the remaining directors couldn’t agree on who should fill it, said the two people familiar with the board’s deliberations.
Justification: the two people familiar with the board’s deliberations

SourcedStatement: Hours after Mr. Altman was ousted, OpenAI executives confronted the remaining board members during a video call, according to three people who were on the call.
Justification: three people who were on the call
